synopsis: In the first part of their deep dive into breakups, hosts Devam and Ahir share personal experiences and insights on the emotional turbulence that follows the end of a relationship. They emphasize the importance of conversation, self-reflection, and the healing process, encouraging listeners to embrace their feelings and seek support from loved ones.
quotes: To love means to let go.
It's very easy to hold on to the things that give you the most comfort in the moment.
Healing means to get to a place where you feel whole by yourself.
Feelings are real; if you push them down, they're going to come out in bad ways.
It's okay to talk about your issues, even if you're going through a tough time.
You have to keep taking it one day at a time.
Sometimes you have to pretend that everything is okay until it actually is.
Being around couples kind of sucks when you're going through a breakup.
I realized that I need to plan less and live more in the moment.
Music has a way of validating your feelings.
